fields.name: Jane Austen
fields.description: A renowned British novelist who wrote several classic novels such as Pride and Prejudice and Sense and Sensibility

fields.name: Mark Twain
fields.description: An American writer who is best known for his works such as The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

fields.name: J.K. Rowling
fields.description: A British author who is best known for writing the Harry Potter series of seven fantasy novels

fields.name: J.D. Salinger
fields.description: An American writer who is best known for his novel The Catcher in the Rye

fields.name: Gabriel García Márquez
fields.description: A Colombian author who was a pioneer of the magical realism literary genre and is best known for his novel One Hundred Years of Solitude

fields.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
fields.description: An English writer who is best known for his works such as The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings trilogy

fields.name: Anne Frank
fields.description: A German-born Jewish girl who is best known for her diary, which documents her experiences hiding from the Nazis during the Holocaust

fields.name: Herman Melville
fields.description: An American writer who is best known for his novel Moby-Dick

fields.name: Leo Tolstoy
fields.description: A Russian writer who is best known for his novels War and Peace and Anna Karenina

fields.name: Ken Follet
fields.description: A Welsh author best known for his historical fiction novels such as The Pillars of the Earth and World Without End.

fields.name: Jean M. Auel
fields.description: An American author best known for her Earth's Children series, which includes the novels The Clan of the Cave Bear and The Shelters of Stone.

fields.name: Leila Meacham
fields.description: An American author best known for her historical fiction novels such as Roses and Tumbleweeds.

fields.name: Maria Dueñas
fields.description: A Spanish author best known for her novel The Time in Between, which is set during the Spanish Civil War and the Second World War.

fields.name: Victoria Holt
fields.description: A pseudonym used by the English author Eleanor Alice Burford Hibbert, who was best known for her gothic romance novels.

fields.name: Frederick Forsyth
fields.description: An English author and journalist best known for his thrillers, including The Day of the Jackal and The Odessa File.

fields.name: Kenizé Mourad
fields.description: A French author best known for her historical fiction novels such as The Last portrait and L’Amant Persan.

fields.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
fields.description: An American author best known for his novels and short stories, such as The Great Gatsby, Tender Is the Night, and This Side of Paradise. Fitzgerald was a prominent figure of the Jazz Age and is considered one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century.

fields.name: Harper Lee
fields.description: An American author best known for her Pulitzer Prize-winning novel To Kill a Mockingbird. Published in 1960, the novel is a classic of modern American literature, dealing with issues of racism and social inequality. Harper Lee's second novel, Go Set a Watchman, was published in 2015.
